content.title: Front-end developer
content.description: A front-end developer is responsible for implementing visual and interactive elements that users engage with through their web browser when using a web application. Skills required include HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React.

content.title: Salesforce admin
content.description: A Salesforce admin is responsible for the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance, and improvement of a Salesforce instance. Skills required include Salesforce administration, configuration, and customization.

content.title: Salesforce developer
content.description: A Salesforce developer is responsible for designing and implementing custom solutions on the Salesforce platform. Skills required include Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning components.

content.title: General IT skills
content.description: General IT skills include basic knowledge of computer hardware and software, as well as the ability to troubleshoot common computer problems. Other skills may include networking, security, and database administration.

content.title: Tech stacks
content.description: Tech stacks refer to the combination of technologies used by a company or organization to build and deploy software applications. Examples of tech stacks include the LAMP stack (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP), the MEAN stack (MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, Node.js), and the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js).

content.title: Soft skills
content.description: Soft skills are non-technical skills that are important for success in the workplace. Examples of soft skills include communication, teamwork, time management, problem solving, and adaptability.
